article.title: Transport_in_Angola
article.heading: Railways
article.paragraph: mainRail transport in AngolaThere are three separate railway lines in Angola:

list.listitem: Luanda Railway(Caminhos de Ferro de LuandaCFL) (northern)
Benguela Railway(Caminho de Ferro de BenguelaCFB) (central)

article.paragraph: Reconstruction of these three lines began in 2005 and is expected to be completed by the end of the year 2012. TheBenguela Railwayalready connects to theDemocratic Republic of the Congo.
article.heading: Waterways
Pipelines
article.paragraph: In April 2012, the Zambian Development Agency (ZDA) and an Angolan company signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to build a multi-product pipeline fromLobitotoLusaka,Zambia, to deliver various refined products to Zambia.cite newshttp://www.times.co.zm/?pGovt, Angola Ink U.S.$2.5 Billion Oil DealChila NamaikoTimes of ZambiaLusaka, Zambia14 April 201229 May 2012cite webhttp://www.times.co.zm/?pAngola ready to ‘oil’ ZambiaTimes of ZambiaLusaka, Zambia9 May 201229 May 2012
Angola plans to build an oil refinery in Lobito in the coming years.
article.heading: Ports and harbors
article.paragraph: File:Cargamento de mineirios, Namibe.JPGthumbShip loading minerals at Namibe harbour, AngolaThe government plans to build a deep-water port atBarra do Dande, north of Luanda, inBengo (province)Bengoprovince nearCaxito.Article in ''Angop'' web portal reporting on the presentation of the general director of the ''Instituto Martimo e Porturio de Angola'', Victor Carvalho
article.heading: Merchant marine

list.listitem: by type:cargo 1, passenger/cargo 2, petroleum tanker 2, roll on/roll off 1

article.heading: Airports
Airports - with paved runways
Airports - with unpaved runways
National Airlines
History
article.paragraph: Angola had an estimated total of 43 airports as of 2004, of which 31 had paved runways as of 2005. There is anLuanda International Airportinternational airport at Luanda. International and domestic services are maintained byTAAG Angola Airlines,Aeroflot,British Airways,Brussels Airlines,Lufthansa,Air France,Air Namibia,Cubana,Ethiopian Airlines,Emirates (airline)Emirates,Delta Air Lines,Royal Air Maroc,Iberia AirlinesIberia,Hainan Airlines,Kenya Airways,South African Airways,TAP Air Portugaland several regional carriers. In 2003, domestic and international carriers carried 198,000 passengers. There are airstrips for domestic transport atBenguela,Cabinda (city)Cabinda,Huambo,Namibe, andCatumbela.
article.heading: References
